snippet: The state became the first to approve nitrogen gas for executions under a measure signed into law Friday, providing an alternative death penalty method if lethal injections are not possible.
abstract: Oklahoma Gov Mary Fallin signs law allowing nitrogen gas to be used for executions under circumstances where lethal injections are not possible.
lead_paragraph: The state became the first to approve nitrogen gas for executions under a measure signed into law Friday, providing an alternative death penalty method if lethal injections are not possible.
